TopicTitle: Do any of these parts exist already in some mod or annother?

Articles.Content:
Ideally properly styled to match the stock parts:

-A 2-kerbal command module scaled appropriately for 1-meter tanks

-Longer (and less ugly) .5 meter fuel tanks

-A 4-way connector scaled to fit the stock Modular Girder Segment

-Larger in-stack RTGs

You'll be hard pressed to find a 2-man pod that's 1.25m in diameter. Kerbals are 1m, so the smallest size pod you can fit two of them in is 2.5m unless you stack the fellas one atop the other. The FASA Mercury & Gemini pack has a brilliant rendition of the Gemini 2-man capsule. I highly recommend it. But it will require 2.5m tanks.

You could definitely fit two kerbals (stacked front to back) in a 1.25m pod. Hell, we can fit 3 ~1.5m tall humans in an ~2 meter Soyuz descent module. But a cylindrical lander-can (or hitchhiker) setup would work too. Basically, there's no way to move two kerbals in a sensible way without dramatically up-sizing and using the Rockomax-compatible parts (I'm playing a game in which I don't allow myself to use any of the larger tanks or engines and don't launch payloads over (about) 10 tons to force myself to construct and fuel all my large ships in orbit. The only exception is the hitchhiker module since I need that for space stations, but something smaller that fulfills the same function is ideal.

What about the other stuff?

Also, are there any .5x.5 structural panels?
